raw_response: {"answer_index": 3, "answer_text": "Blunting of costophrenic angle", "confidence": 9, "reasoning": "This patient presents with signs of a pleural effusion (dullness to percussion, decreased breath sounds, decreased tactile fremitus over the left lung base) following a recent respiratory illness. On chest x-ray, pleural effusion typically manifests as blunting of the costophrenic angle. The other options are less likely: elevation of the diaphragm is seen with phrenic nerve palsy or abdominal processes; ground glass appearance is seen in interstitial lung diseases or pulmonary edema; widened intercostal spaces are seen in hyperinflation (e.g., emphysema).", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
